clinical_study.brief_title: Objective and Perceived Quality Study in Patients Undergoing Elective Groin Hernia Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Objective and Perceived Quality Study in Patients Undergoing Elective Groin Hernia Surgery by the Abdominal Wall Surgery Unit of the Hospital Complex of Navarra

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective non-comparative observational study of cohorts. Consists on offering surveys to every patient undergoing groin hernia surgery in our Abdominal Wall Surgery Unit, in Hospital of Navarra.

detailed_description.textblock:
HYPOTHESIS:
The objective and perceived quality data of the patients under study (adult patients undergoing scheduled inguinal hernia without complications) in Pamplona are within the international quality standards.
OBJECTIVES
Primary objective:
-Obtaining data of objective and perceived quality of patients undergoing elective groin hernia surgery in Pamplona durinag a year to compare them with international quality standards.
Secondary objectives:
- Obtaining data on duration of sick leave (temporary disability due to common contingency) associated with the referred procedures, as well as their possible complications.
- Assess the costs associated with the intervention and its possible complications.
- Raise options (if necessary and feasible) to improve the results exposed obtained by our service.

primary_outcome.measure: Obtaining objective and perceived quality of life
primary_outcome.description: Obtaining data about objective and perceived quality of life of patients undergoing elective inguinal hernia surgery in Pamplona during a year to compare them with international quality standards

secondary_outcome.description: Level of pain, before and after surgery
Percentage of patients with hernia recurrence during study surveillance

secondary_outcome.measure: Controlling presence or not of complications
secondary_outcome.description: Presence or not of postop complicationes
Grade of patient satisfaction with surgery result
Patient waiting time until surgery date

intervention.intervention_name: Short form 36 quality of life survey
intervention.description: Prospective non-comparative observational study of cohorts

study_pop.textblock: Patients undergoing elective inguinal hernia surgery en Pamplona

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients entering surgical waiting list during a year (from March 1st, 2018, to February 28th, 2019).
- Elective surgery.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age below 16.
- Mental diseases.
- Patients not capable of understanding the study.
- Patients that reject entering the study.
